title: Home invader slashes woman at Hope Valley
text:
A grandmother has been injured by a home invader possibly armed with a knife during a violent confrontation at Hope Valley.

The brazen intruder gained entry to the unoccupied John Ramsay Cicuit house but was startled by the woman’s arrival home about 12.20pm on Wednesday.

The Advertiser understands the 62-year-old woman confronted the suspect and was injured during a scuffle. She was treated by paramedics at the scene.

Police believe jewellery and other items were stolen before the suspect fled.

media_camera A police officer takes photos of the crime scene. Picture: Tait Schmaal

Detectives and undercover officers are searching nearby streets and a police dog was called in the aid to hunt.

Crime Scene investigators dusted for fingerprints on the home’s rear fence. It is unclear if the man entered, or escaped, the property that way.

Officers are speaking to possible witnesses and have told other residents to keep their houses locked.

media_camera Crime Scene investigators dusted for fingerprints on the home’s rear fence on John Ramsay Circuit, Hope Valley. Picture: Ben Harvy

A nearby resident, who wished to remain anonymous, described the victim as a “nice lady”.

“It terrifies me. I’d be too worried to leave my wife now,” he said.

“(The family) is fabulous. I hope (they catch the suspect), especially if he’s used a knife.”

The suspect is described as Caucasian, aged about 20 to 30-years-old, slim build, wearing a white cap, shorts and had a jumper tied around his waist. He may be carrying an orange and white plastic Myer bag.

Anyone who witnessed any suspicious behaviour in the area is urged to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or report on line at crimestopperssa.com.au
